00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //The world that integrates everything
00044 //
00045 //This is where all the calls to the the underlying libraries should be from.
00046 //World is an abstraction layer to all of the non-ui libraries. The ui
00047 //layers wx and ogre both have their own main loops, so it is almost mandatory
00048 //for other code to interact with those libraries directly.
00049 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00091     World::World()
00092     {
00093         Vector3 Lbounds(-1000.0,-1000.0,-1000.0);
00094         Vector3 Ubounds(1000.0,1000.0,1000.0);
00095         std::vector <ManagerBase*> temp;
00096 
00097         this->Construct(Lbounds, Ubounds, 10, SceneManager::Generic, "Physgame.log", temp);
00098     }

00137     void World::Construct(  const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_,
00138                                 const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_,
00139                                 const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_,
00140                                 SceneManager::SceneManagerType SceneType,
00141                                 std::string LogFileName,
00142                                 std::vector <ManagerBase*> ManagerToBeAdded)
00143     {
00144         //Set some sane Defaults for some values
00145         this->SetWindowName("AppName");
00146         this->TargetFrameLength=16;
00147         this->HasSDLBeenInitialized=false;
00148         this->FrameTime = 0;
00149         Ogre::Root* OgreCore = new Ogre::Root(crossplatform::GetPluginsDotCFG(),crossplatform::GetSettingsDotCFG(),"Physgame.log");
00150 
00151         assert(0==World::TheRealWorld);
00152         World::TheRealWorld = this;
00153 
00154         //add each manager that was passed in to the manager list
00155         for(std::vector<ManagerBase*>::iterator iter = ManagerToBeAdded.begin(); iter!= ManagerToBeAdded.end(); iter++)
00156             { this->AddManager(*iter); }
00157 
00158         //Create and add any managers that have not been taken care of yet.
00159         if(this->GetActorManager()==0)
00160             { this->AddManager(new ActorContainerVector()); }
00161         if(this->GetGraphicsManager()==0)
00162             { this->AddManager(new GraphicsManager()); }
00163         if(this->GetSoundManager()==0)
00164             { this->AddManager(new SoundManager()); }
00165         if(this->GetResourceManager()==0)
00166             { this->AddManager(new ResourceManager()); }
00167         if(this->GetEventManager()==0)
00168             { this->AddManager(new EventManager()); }
00169         if(this->GetPhysicsManager()==0)
00170             { this->AddManager(new PhysicsManager(GeographyLowerBounds_,GeographyUpperbounds_,MaxPhysicsProxies_)); }
00171         if(this->GetSceneManager()==0)
00172             { this->AddManager(new SceneManager(SceneType)); }
00173         if(this->GetUIManager()==0)
00174             { this->AddManager(new UIManager()); }
00175         if(this->GetTimerManager()==0)
00176             { this->AddManager(new TimerManager()); }
00177 
00178         // This Tests various assumptions about the way the platform works, and will not act
00179         SanityChecks();
00180     }
00181 
00182     void World::SanityChecks()
00183     {
00184         crossplatform::WaitMilliseconds(1500);
00185         //Perform a Test that only needs to be done once for the SDL/Physuserinputevent system.`
00186         Log("Verifying size of userinput events:");
00187         Log(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode));
00188         Log(sizeof(SDLKey));
00189         Log(sizeof(int));
00190         if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(SDLKey))
00191         {
00192             LogAndThrow("User input subsystem Event Sizes  Don't match, userinput subsystem will go down faster than 'that' girl on prom night.");
00193         }else{
00194             Log("External User input subsystem Event Sizes match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00195         }
00196 
00197         if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(int))
00198         {
00199             LogAndThrow("Internal User input subsystem Event Sizes Don't match, userinput subsystem cannot function.");
00200         }else{
00201             Log("Internal User input subsystem Event Sizes match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00202         }
00203     }

00205     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00206     //tears the world down
00207     World::~World()
00208     {
00209         for(std::list<ManagerBase*>::iterator iter = this->ManagerList.begin(); iter!= ManagerList.end(); iter++)
00210         {
00211             delete (*iter);
00212         }
00213         ManagerList.clear();
00214 
00215         //All the pointers Ogre made should get taken care of by OGRE
00216         Ogre::Root::getSingleton().shutdown();
00217     }

00219     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00220     //appends to the gamelog which is managed by Ogre
00221     void World::LogString(const String& Message)
00222     {
00223         static std::stringstream* Audiolog = 0;
00224         if (0 == Audiolog)
00225         {
00226             Audiolog = this->GetSoundManager()->GetLogs();
00227         }else{
00228             Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(Audiolog->str());
00229             Audiolog->str("");
00230         }
00231 
00232         if( this->LogStream.str().size() > 0 )
00233         {
00234             Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(this->LogStream.str());
00235             this->LogStream.str("");
00236         }
00237 
00238         if(Message.size()>0)
00239             { Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(Message); }
00240 
00241     }
00242 
00243     void World::Log()
00244     {
00245         this->LogString("");
00246     }

00248     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00249     // Start the Game already
00250     void World::GameInit( const bool &CallMainLoop )
00251     {
00252         //#define PHYSDEBUG
00253         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00254         this->Log("Entering GameInit()");
00255         #endif
00256 
00257         this->LoadOgreSettings();
00258         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00259         this->Log("Loaded Graphics Settings");
00260         #endif
00261 
00262         //this->CreateRenderWindow();
00263         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00264         this->Log("Created the Render Work");
00265         #endif
00266 
00267         //Some managers depend on the functionality of other managers, so they must be initialized in order.
00268         GetGraphicsManager()->Initialize();
00269         GetPhysicsManager()->Initialize();
00270 
00271         //Remaining Non-Critical managers get initialized.
00272         for (std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator Iter=this->ManagerList.begin(); Iter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++Iter )
00273         {
00274             this->LogStream << "Initializing " << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " Manager" << endl;
00275             if((*Iter)->GetType() != ManagerBase::GraphicsManager && (*Iter)->GetType() != ManagerBase::PhysicsManager)
00276             {
00277                 (*Iter)->Initialize();
00278             }
00279         }
00280         HasSDLBeenInitialized = GetGraphicsManager()->HasSDLBeenInitialized();
00281 
00282         if(CallMainLoop)
00283         {
00284             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00285             this->Log("Starting the main loop");
00286             #endif
00287             this->MainLoop();
00288         }else{
00289             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00290             this->Log("Not calling the main loop");
00291             #endif
00292         }
00293     }
00294 
00295     void World::MainLoop()
00296     {
00297         /// @todo create a lighting manager and put this in there
00298         //this->OgreSceneManager->setAmbientLight( Ogre::ColourValue( 1, 1, 1 ) );
00299 
00300         /*! @page mainloop1 Main Loop Structure and Flow
00301          The MainLoop is heart of most video games and simulations.
00302 
00303          @section mainloopoverview1 Main loop Overview
00304          The Main loop runs in World.MainLoop() which is called by default from @ref World.GameInit(). By default this Method also starts the render, the physics andthe input systems. It does very
00305          little on it's own. The main loop then calls the PreMainLoopItems(), DoMainLoopItems and PreMainLoopItems(), for each manager in the order of their priority from Lowest to Highest.
00306          \n Here is a listing of  default priorities for each of the managers the a world intantiates by default:
00307             -50 User Input and events
00308             -40 Actors
00309             -30 Physics
00310             -20 Camera
00311             -10 Lighting (Not yet implemented)
00312               0 Graphics
00313              10 Sound
00314              20 Resources
00315         */
00316 
00317         Ogre::Timer* LoopTimer = new Ogre::Timer();
00318         //As long as all the CallBacks return true the game continues
00319         bool DoNotBreak=true;
00320         while (DoNotBreak)
00321         {
00322             for (std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator Iter=this->ManagerList.begin(); Iter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++Iter )
00323             {
00324                 //#ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00325                 this->LogStream << "Current Manager: " << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " ";
00326                 this->Log( (*Iter)->GetPriority() );
00327                 LoopTimer->reset();
00328                 //#endif
00329 
00330                 if( !(*Iter)->PreMainLoopItems() )
00331                     { DoNotBreak=false; }
00332 
00333                 (*Iter)->DoMainLoopItems();
00334 
00335                 if( !(*Iter)->PostMainLoopItems() )
00336                     { DoNotBreak=false; }
00337 
00338                 this->LogStream << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " took " << LoopTimer->getMicroseconds() << " microseconds.";
00339                 this->Log();
00340                 this->DoMainLoopLogging();
00341             }
00342 
00343         }//End of main loop
00344 
00345         //Some after loop cleanup
00346         Whole X = 0;
00347         //this->DestroyRenderWindow();
00348     }
00349 
00350     void  World::DoMainLoopLogging()
00351     {
00352         this->Log(this->LogStream.str());
00353         this->LogStream.str("");
00354     }

00360     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00361     //Loads the Ogre Configuration
00362     void World::LoadOgreSettings()
00363     {
00364         //Try loading from the default location
00365         if (!Ogre::Root::getSingleton().restoreConfig())
00366         {
00367             //if we can't do that then lets make new settings
00368             if (!this->GetGraphicsManager()->ShowGraphicsSettingDialog())
00369             {
00370                 this->LogAndThrow("Error: Could not setup Ogre.");
00371             }
00372         }
00373     }

00390         }

00418     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00419     // Upper Management
00420     ///////////////////////////////////////
00421     void World::AddManager(ManagerBase* ManagerToAdd)
00422     {
00423         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00424         this->LogStream << "Calling World::AddManager("<<ManagerToAdd<<") size before:" <<this->ManagerList.size();
00425         #endif
00426         if(!this->ManagerList.empty())
00427         {
00428             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00429             {
00430                 if( (*ManIter)->GetPriority() > ManagerToAdd->GetPriority())
00431                 {
00432                     this->ManagerList.insert(ManIter, ManagerToAdd);
00433                     #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00434                     this->LogStream << " - Added by sorted insertion:"<<ManagerToAdd<<" - size after:" <<this->ManagerList.size() ;
00435                     #endif
00436                     return;
00437                 }
00438             }
00439         }
00440         ManagerList.push_back(ManagerToAdd);
00441         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00442         this->LogStream << " - Added by push_back:"<<ManagerToAdd<<" - size after:" <<this->ManagerList.size() << endl;
00443         #endif
00444     }
00445 
00446     void World::RemoveManager(ManagerBase* ManagerToRemove)
00447     {
00448         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00449         {
00450             // do nothing
00451         }else{
00452             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00453             {
00454                 if( *ManIter == ManagerToRemove )
00455                 {
00456                     this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00457                     break;
00458                 }
00459             }
00460         }
00461     }
00462 
00463     void World::RemoveManager(const ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName &ManagersToRemoveType, short unsigned int WhichOne)
00464     {
00465         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00466         {
00467             //do nothing
00468         }else{
00469             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00470             {
00471                 if( (*ManIter)->GetType() == ManagersToRemoveType )
00472                 {
00473                     if(0==WhichOne)     // we use our copy of WhichOne as a countdown to 0
00474                     {
00475                         this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00476                     }else{
00477                         --WhichOne;
00478                     }
00479                 }
00480             }
00481         }
00482     }
00483 
00484     ManagerBase* World::GetManager(const ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName &ManagersToGet, short unsigned int WhichOne)
00485     {
00486         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00487         this->LogStream << "Calling World::GetManager(Type:"<<ManagersToGet<<") searching through "<<this->ManagerList.size()<<" Items.";
00488         #endif
00489         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00490         {
00491             return 0;
00492         }else{
00493             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00494             {
00495                 if( (*ManIter)->GetType() == ManagersToGet )
00496                 {
00497                     if(0==WhichOne)     // we use our copy of WhichOne as a countdown to 0
00498                     {
00499                         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00500                         this->LogStream << " - Got:" << *ManIter <<endl;
00501                         #endif
00502                         return *ManIter;
00503                     }else{
00504                         --WhichOne;
00505                     }
00506                 }
00507             }
00508         }
00509         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00510         this->LogStream << " - Got:Nothing" << endl;
00511         #endif
00512         return 0;
00513     }
00514 
00515     void World::UpdateManagerOrder(ManagerBase* ManagerToChange, short int Priority_)
00516     {
00517         ManagerToChange->SetPriority(Priority_);
00518         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00519         {
00520             ManagerList.push_back(ManagerToChange);
00521         }else{
00522             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00523             {
00524                 if( (*ManIter)->GetPriority() > ManagerToChange->GetPriority() )
00525                 {
00526                     this->ManagerList.insert(ManIter,ManagerToChange);
00527                 }else if(*ManIter == ManagerToChange )
00528                 {
00529                     this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00530                 }
00531             }
00532         }
00533     }
00534 
00535     void World::UpdateManagerOrder()
00536     {
00537         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00538         {
00539             //do nothing
00540         }else{
00541             std::list< ManagerBase* > temp; //(this->ManagerList.begin(),this->ManagerList.end());
00542             temp.swap(this->ManagerList);
00543             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator TempIter = temp.begin(); TempIter!=temp.end(); ++TempIter )
00544             {
00545                 this->AddManager(*TempIter);
00546             }
00547         }
00548     }
